tool.name: milkyway_crux_percolator
tool.command: cwd=`pwd`; tar -zxvf $pin_targz 2>&1; python /galaxy-central/tools/wohl-proteomics/MSGFcrux/crux_perco_wrapper.py newoutput/ $exp_file crux percolator --train-fdr $trainFDR --test-fdr $testFDR --maxiter $maxiter --pout-output T --decoy-xml-output T --top-match $topmatch $unitnorm $testeachiteration $klammer --txt-output T --overwrite T --decoy-prefix $pattern --percolator-seed time --search-input separate --tdc F #if $protein.protein_mode --protein T $protein.allowproteingroup $protein.empiricalproteinq $protein.fidonopruneproteins $protein.fidogroupproteins --fido-gridsearch-depth $protein.fidogridsearchdepth 2>&1; #else $protein.onlypsms 2>&1; #end if tar -cvf - output/ 2>/dev/null | pigz -9 -p 24 > $crux_tar_gz 2>&1;

param.name: trainFDR
param.label: Training FDR
param.help: False discovery rate threshold to define positive examples in training. Set by cross validation if 0. Default is 0.01.

param.name: testFDR
param.label: Testing FDR
param.help: False discovery rate threshold for evaluating best cross validation result and the reported end result. Default is 0.01.

param.name: topmatch
param.label: Top matches to report per PSM

param.name: unitnorm
param.label: Use unit normalization?
param.help: Use unit normalization [0-1] instead of standard deviation normalization

param.name: testeachiteration
param.label: Test Each Iteration?
param.help: Measure performance on test set each iteration.

param.name: klammer
param.label: Klammer retention time features?
param.help: Retention time features calculated as in Klammer et al.?

param.name: protein_mode
param.label: Protein level probabilities?
param.help: If this option is not checked, peptide level PEP is calculated

param.name: onlypsms
param.label: --only-psms
param.help: Consider all PSMs, not just the highest quality

param.name: allowproteingroup
param.label: Allow Protein Groups?
param.help: treat ties as if it were one protein

param.name: fidonopruneproteins
param.label: Fido No Prune Proteins?
param.help: it does not prune peptides with a very low score (~0.0) which means that if a peptide with a very low score is matching two proteins, when we prune the peptide, it will be duplicated to generate two new protein groups.

param.name: fidogroupproteins
param.label: Fido Group Proteins
param.help: Treat ties as if it were one protein

param.name: fidogridsearchdepth
param.label: Fido Gridsearch Depth
param.help: Setting depth 0 or 1 or 2 from low depth to high depth(less computational time) of the grid search for the estimation Alpha,Beta and Gamma Default value is 0.
